definitions: relating to or of the nature of dramatic or artistic performance

examples.text: films which push past the limits of current performative trends

shortDefinitions: relating to or of nature of dramatic or artistic performance

definitions: characterized by the performance of a social or cultural role

examples.text: many feminist theorists have come to stress the contextual and performative aspects of gender

shortDefinitions: characterized by performance of social or cultural role

definitions: relating to or denoting an utterance by means of which the speaker performs a particular act (e.g. I bet, I apologize, I promise)

examples.text: performative utterances do not merely describe what one is doing; to say the utterance is to do it

shortDefinitions: of utterance by means of which speaker performs particular act

definitions: a performative verb, sentence, or utterance

examples.text: here statements are not descriptive utterances but performatives
